summary: Email correspondence from attorney Marc A. Weinstein regarding the response to a grand jury subpoena for documents related to prior trusts referenced in Jeffrey Epstein's wills, and a mention of the US Virgin Islands Attorney General's motion to intervene in the estate administration.

persons.name: Marc A. Weinstein
persons.role: Partner, Chair of White Collar Defense at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP
persons.context: Attorney representing or corresponding on behalf of the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, sending documents in response to a grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Andrew Tomback
persons.context: Cc'd on the email regarding the grand jury subpoena response; likely a government attorney involved in the investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The estate and prior wills are the subject of the grand jury subpoena and document production.

connections.description: Weinstein appears to be acting as legal counsel for the executors of Epstein's estate, handling document production in response to a subpoena.
Weinstein is communicating with Tomback, likely a prosecutor, regarding the fulfillment of a grand jury subpoena.

events.title: Email acknowledgment of document receipt
events.description: An email from an external party (likely a prosecutor's office) acknowledges receipt of three emails containing documents marked with Bates numbers.

events.title: Weinstein's email regarding subpoena response and USVI motion
events.description: Marc A. Weinstein sends an email regarding the grand jury subpoena response and mentions the US Virgin Islands Attorney General's motion to intervene in the Epstein estate administration.

events.title: Production of prior wills
events.description: Prior wills of Jeffrey Epstein were produced on this date, as referenced in the email chain.

events.title: Grand jury subpoenas issued to executors
events.description: Grand jury subpoenas were issued to the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, prompting the document request discussed in the email.

locations: New York, NY 10004-1482 (Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP office at One Battery Park Plaza)
US Virgin Islands (mentioned in context of Attorney General's motion)
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued to the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate on October 18, 2019, seeking documents related to prior trusts referenced in Epstein's wills.
Attorney Marc A. Weinstein, representing the estate, produced documents in response to the subpoena on January 24-25, 2020.
The US Virgin Islands Attorney General filed a motion to intervene in the Epstein estate administration and opposed the proposed claims program, as noted in the email.
The email chain involves the transmission of documents marked with Bates numbers (G.1_000198 through 6.1_000459 and others), indicating formal document production in a legal investigation.
